resources.string: Modeling the movement of the satellites around the planet
Version 1.0\nCopyright Â© 2012 Vinevcev D. I.\nWritten at Home PC
The first satellite collide with the earth. Its distance from the center of the earth shall be not less than %1$s
Satellite with a height of %1$s encounters with the satellite from a height of %2$s. The distance between them should be at least %3$s
Time must be long.\nDistance must be float
Here, the speed - this time, in milliseconds, for which the satellite makes a complete revolution around the globe
Distance - The length, in dp (density-independent pixels) from the center of the earth to the satellite center
There are no satellites. Refer to the settings screen to add satellites or through the options menu, or from the main menu
